qas.question: What was notable about the discovered vitamin A?
Which property was vitamin B found to have?
Which disease was vitamin C claimed to help prevent?
What was cod liver oil able to help cure in dogs?
What was referred to as "food factor X"?

context: In 1913, Elmer McCollum discovered the first vitamins, <a0_0>fat-soluble<a0_0/> vitamin A, and <a1_0>water-soluble<a1_0/> vitamin B (in 1915; now known to be a complex of several water-soluble vitamins) and named vitamin C as the then-unknown substance preventing <a2_0>scurvy<a2_0/>. Lafayette Mendel and Thomas Osborne also performed pioneering work on vitamins A and B. In 1919, Sir Edward Mellanby incorrectly identified <a3_0>rickets<a3_0/> as a vitamin A deficiency because he could cure it in dogs with cod liver oil. In 1922, McCollum destroyed the vitamin A in cod liver oil, but found that it still cured rickets. Also in 1922, H.M. Evans and L.S. Bishop discover <a4_0>vitamin E<a4_0/> as essential for rat pregnancy, originally calling it "food factor X" until 1925.
